definition: to donate blood/also written 供血

sentences.english: Another example is the blood donation campaign.
sentences.chinese: 另一个例子是捐血战役。

sentences.english: We need AB blood donors urgently because a patient's life is at stake.
sentences.chinese: 我们急需AB型捐血人，因为有一名病人的性命垂危。

sentences.english: In Hong Kong, blood donation programme was first introduced by the Red Cross back in 1952.
sentences.chinese: 香港红十字会于1952年推行自愿无偿捐血计划。

sentences.english: Some people are very glad to donate because they believe their blood can be helpful for others who are in need.
sentences.chinese: 一些人很乐意献血应为他们认为捐血能够帮助其他人。

sentences.english: For some of the donors including the superstar himself, it was their first time donating blood.
sentences.chinese: 他们中的一些人，包括吴尊本人都是第一次捐血。

sentences.english: Tree planting, flag selling, blood donation and other community work.
sentences.chinese: 植树，卖旗，捐血及其它社会服务。

sentences.english: The center will refuse HIV positive donating blood if they are on the list.
sentences.chinese: 如经查属不适捐血名单，即婉拒捐血。

sentences.english: The center will refuse HIV positive donating blood if they are on the list.
sentences.chinese: 如经查属不适捐血名单，即婉拒捐血。

sentences.english: Fifteen minutes later, I was done with donating blood and was very proud of myself.
sentences.chinese: 十五分钟后，我捐血完毕，自己也感到十分骄傲。

sentences.english: In my opinion, I think people should donate blood.
sentences.chinese: 就我来说，我认为人们应该捐血。

sentences.english: First of all, donating blood will benefit others.
sentences.chinese: 首先，捐血可以让他人受益。

sentences.english: Does it help if I donate blood?

pinyin: Xiang1 gang3 Hong2 Shi2 zi4 hui4

definition: to do a blood test/to have one's blood tested
variant of 艾滋病[ai4 zi1 bing4]
AIDS (loanword)/see also 愛滋病|爱滋病[ai4 zi1 bing4]
health bureau (or office, or department, or agency)
